text: Fei's small tree frog (Romerus feii) is a frog. It lives in China and Vietnam. Scientists have seen it between 350 and 1163 meters above sea level. ==Appearance== The adult male frog is about 16.2 to 17.6 mm long from nose to rear end and the adult female frog is 18.0 to 18.7 mm long. This frog has a mark in the shape of an X on its back. There is a mark between the eyes. ==Name== Scientists named this frog after amphibian scientist Professor Liang Fei. ==Home== This frog lives in forests that have never been cut down. People see it on the dead leaves on the ground. The place where this frog lives has two protected parks in it: Heishiding Nature Reserve and Dayaoshan Nature Reserve. ==Young== Scientists think this frog's tadpoles swim in water-filled holes in plants such as trees or bamboo. ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Romerus feii
